prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing congratulations greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Congrats dudester! You completely crushed it. "
Style: üñºÔ∏è Impressionist
Tone: üòÑ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: John
From: Rob
Message: "John,

Seriously, they're going to have to invent a new word for how awesome you were. I checked the dictionary and "crushed it" now just has your picture next to it. Well done, my friend!

All the best,
Rob"

Reference: "artistic transformation"

CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details





- Create cartoon/illustrated characters inspired by reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions

Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "congratulations" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). I have included my own reference image. Create a stylized cartoon/illustrated character inspired by the reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions of real people, instead create charming cartoon-style characters with simplified, friendly features. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in impressionist painting style like Monet and Renoir, with soft brush strokes, light and shadow play, and dreamy atmospheric effects

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a congratulations card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in impressionist painting style like Monet and Renoir, with soft brush strokes, light and shadow play, and dreamy atmospheric effects

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "John,

Seriously, they're going to have to invent a new word for how awesome you were. I checked the dictionary and "crushed it" now just has your picture next to it. Well done, my friend!

All the best,
Rob" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Style: in impressionist painting style like Monet and Renoir, with soft brush strokes, light and shadow play, and dreamy atmospheric effects

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in impressionist painting style like Monet and Renoir, with soft brush strokes, light and shadow play, and dreamy atmospheric effects

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:

```json

  "frontCover": "Front cover of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio. The image is in a vibrant Impressionist painting style, reminiscent of Monet and Renoir, with visible, soft brushstrokes and a focus on light and atmospheric effects. The sky is a warm blend of blues and fiery oranges, suggesting a sunset or sunrise, with fluffy, dreamlike clouds. Dominating the center is a stylized, anthropomorphic hot dog character, depicted with cartoonish charm and friendly, exaggerated features. This character has a cheerful expression, a single, blond quiff of hair, and wears a bun like a jaunty hat. On its body, the letters \"FLO H\" are visible. The hot dog character is triumphantly standing with one foot raised, perched atop a pile of colorful, discarded soda cans. The cans are rendered with Impressionistic blurriness, showing hints of red, blue, and green, implying various brands without explicit detail. To the left and slightly behind the hot dog, there's a glimpse of a quaint, American-style gazebo or stand, decorated with red and white stripes and blue accents with stars. In the background, soft-focus, Impressionistic buildings with warm-toned facades can be seen. The overall mood is lighthearted and celebratory. The text \"Congrats dudester!\" is rendered in a creamy, bold, and slightly whimsical script font, positioned in the upper portion of the card, well within the safe margins, against the sky.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio. The artwork continues the Impressionist painting style with soft, visible brushstrokes and a warm, atmospheric glow. The scene is a subtle nod to the front cover, featuring a simplified, serene landscape. In the foreground, a few scattered, Impressionistically rendered soda cans, blurred and muted in color, lie on a patch of grassy ground, hinting at the celebratory aftermath. The background consists of a warm, softly blended sky with hints of orange and blue clouds, mirroring the front cover's sky but in a more subdued, peaceful manner. The overall composition is minimalist and tranquil, suggesting a gentle conclusion to the story. No text or characters are present, allowing the artistic elements to provide a quiet, complementary ending.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior page of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio. The scene depicts a fantastical, whimsical landscape representing the \"crushing it\" theme. Imagine a rolling hill painted with Impressionistic strokes, where giant, stylized soda cans are scattered like boulders, some tilted, some upright, all rendered with softened colors and light. Emerging from behind these cans, or perhaps growing from the ground, are oversized, Impressionistic flowers and foliage in vibrant but softly blended colors ‚Äì think bold yellows, blues, and reds, but with a painterly, less defined quality. A winding, Impressionistic path made of shimmering light or crushed can fragments leads towards a distant, hazy horizon. The mood is playful and expansive, suggesting a world built from success and celebration.   "rightInterior": "Right interior page of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio. The background is a soft, gradient wash of warm sky colors, transitioning from a pale blue at the top to a soft orange or golden hue at the bottom. Embracing the central message space are abstract, flowing forms that evoke the idea of an \"artistic transformation\" and a dictionary. Interspersed within these swirling forms are subtle, Impressionistic motifs that hint at dictionaries or award ribbons ‚Äì perhaps stylized, blurred representations of open books, or delicate, feathery strokes resembling laurel leaves. The colors are soft and complementary, blending seamlessly with the background. The text \"John,\\n\\nSeriously, they're going to have to invent a new word for how awesome you were. I checked the dictionary and \"crushed it\" now just has your picture next to it. Well done, my friend!\\n\\nAll the best,\\nRob\" is presented in a clear, readable, and slightly elegant serif font, with each line spaced comfortably within the decorative elements. The overall impression is sophisticated, artistic, and celebratory, perfectly encapsulating the message's sentiment."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover:
Here's a detailed prompt for the back cover of the greeting card, designed to generate an image matching the provided example:

Back cover design for a greeting card with an impressionist painting style, evoking a peaceful and subtly creative conclusion to the visual story. The artwork should feature a serene landscape inspired by the front cover, but with a more minimalist and atmospheric focus. The scene depicts a soft, slightly out-of-focus field of grass in muted green and yellow tones, leading towards a hazy, distant mountain range rendered in soft blues and purples. The sky above is a gentle gradient of warm, pale yellow, transitioning to a soft sky blue at the horizon. A few scattered, impressionistically rendered elements, similar to the fallen petals or leaves from the front cover, are floating gently in the air or resting on the grass, maintaining a sense of delicate movement. The overall color palette is consistent with the front cover, emphasizing soft, natural light and muted, blended tones. There is no text or any specific illustrative elements of people; the focus is on the atmospheric landscape to provide a sense of quiet resolution. The composition is simple, allowing the viewer's eye to rest on the serene scene. There is no visible space reserved for a QR code.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a congratulations greeting card with an impressionist painting style, featuring bold, expressive brushstrokes. The background is a vibrant explosion of color, dominated by bright yellows and oranges radiating outwards from the bottom center, transitioning into hot pinks, oranges, and finally a deep, rich blue towards the edges. The brushstrokes create a sense of dynamic movement and energy, evoking a feeling of overwhelming success and celebration. There is no text or characters present, allowing the abstract art to convey the message of achievement and excitement. The composition is full-bleed, with the energetic colorburst filling the entire 9:16 frame, maintaining visual continuity with the overall theme of "crushing it."
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with the text: "John, Seriously, they're going to have to invent a new word for how awesome you were. I checked the dictionary and "crushed it" now just has your picture next to it. Well done, my friend! All the best, Rob". The text is centrally placed, using a classic, elegant script font in a deep black color. The background is a soft, creamy parchment color with subtle, watercolor-like washes of light blue and yellow. Framing the message on the left and sweeping up and over the text in a large, graceful arc is an abstract, impressionistic flourish composed of broad, blended brushstrokes in vibrant rainbow colors ‚Äì red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple. The brushwork is soft and painterly, mimicking the style of Impressionist masters like Monet, with visible texture and a gentle play of light and shadow. The overall composition is balanced, with the colorful flourish providing a dynamic yet harmonious counterpoint to the clear, readable text, creating a celebratory and artistic feel. The style is flat 2D artwork for printing, with a full-bleed background.
